item.title: An example of differences between compilers
item.description:
For the code fragment below,

//ch1.c
#include "stdio.h"
int main(int argc, char const *argv[]) {
    int a = 1;
    int c = (a=a * 2) + (a = a + 3);
    printf("a = %d, c = %d.\n", a, c);
    return 0;
}

if gcc is used to compile it, there are no errors or warnings. Run the biniary file and we will get:

a = 5, c = 10.

However, if I use clang to compile the codes, there will be a warning:

ch1.c:6:15: warning: multiple unsequenced modifications to ‘a’ [-Wunsequenced]

Run the generated file:

a = 5, c = 7.

Personally, I think clang is better than gcc in dealing this problem. But why I, the programmer, write such unreadable codes?!

item.title: brew with a socks5 proxy
item.description:
Finally, I find the right way to use homebrew.

set a socks proxy with git for the http transport

git config --global http.proxy 'socks5://127.0.0.1:1081'

set a socks proxy for curl: jsut add proxy=socks5://127.0.0.1:1081 to ~/.curlrc.

Too much time have been wasted because of the poor network.

item.title: Watch Video on Bilibili via bilidan.py on OS X
item.description:
Install homebrew

ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"

Install python3, ffmpeg and mpv using homebrew

brew install python3 ffmpeg Caskroom/cask/mpv

Get the python script bilidan.py

git clone https://github.com/m13253/BiliDan.git

Let bilidan.py executable

chmod u+x BiliDan/bilidan.py

Open the terminal and run the following codes:

BiliDan/bilidan.py http://www.bilibili.com/video/av715519/

Now we can watch the video without Flash Player!

Tips: you may need to wait the mpv player for some minutes the first time you run the codes above. Just be patient.

Thanks to m13253 for the projects BiliDan and danmaku2ass!

item.title: Make unix2doc a system service of OS X
item.description:
Revising academic papers is really a hard work. What makes things worse is that WinEdit used by my mentor is only able to open .tex files with CRLF line breaks while TeXShop.app uses LF as a line ending.

item.title: 设置 Mathematica 的默认字号
item.description:
Mathematica 的默认字体看起太小，尤其我的 MacBook 没有配 Retina 屏幕，看起来伤眼睛。

在 Mathematica 的 Format->Option Inspector 中以fontsize搜索Global Preference，修改12为16。但是，尝试多次，重启 Mathematica 也无效。要对 Mathematica 粉转黑了！

最后，在StackExchange找到了一个曲线救国的方法：NotebookOptions->Display Options->Magnification，把1修改为1.5或其他，即把整个 notebook 的显示全局放大。

item.title: 配置 Sublime Text 的 LaTeX 写作环境
item.description:
又开始折腾了。。。

安装 LaTeXTools

  1. View -> Show Console，打开终端界面，将 Package Control 官网给出的代码复制粘贴进终端，回车完成 Package Control 的安装。
  2. Command-Shift-P调出命令窗口，输入Install，等待一会，之后输入LaTeXTools，回车完成安装，时常取决于网络。
  3. 安装 Skim，用于预览编译好的PDF文件。

初始设置

LaTeXTools

  1. 初始化：按下Command-Shift-P，输入”latextools”，选择”LaTeXTools:Reconfigure…“，回车。
  2. 设置编译时输出详细日志：前往~/Library/Application Support/Sublime Text 3/Packages/User/，打开LaTeXTools.sublime-settings，将"display_log" : false,改为"display_log" : true,。这样编译时心里有个底，看屏幕上输出一段一段高端大气的代码然后生成精美的 paper 的时候的快感怎么能少？

  3. 设置默认使用 XeLaTeX 编译文件：虽然可以去修改LaTeXTools.sublime-settings,不过最简单安全的方法还是在自己的 TeX 源文件开头加上%!TEX program = xelatex，修改一下自己的模板就一劳永逸了，难道每次都从输入\begin{document}开始？

    Skim

    在 Skim 的选项-同步中，不要勾选“检查文件变化”，“同步支持”选择“Sumlime Text”

Skim 与 Sublime Text 之间的跳转按键

  • Skim：Command-Shift-J
  • Sublime Text：Command-L,松开Command，迅速按下J
